message_1: Suppose you have a plaintext message "HELLO" and you want to encrypt it using a substitution cipher that maps each letter to its corresponding alphabetical position. Write the encrypted message using this substitution cipher.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using a substitution cipher that maps each letter to its corresponding alphabetical position, we will replace each letter with its position in the alphabet:

H -> 8
E -> 5
L -> 12
L -> 12
O -> 15

So the encrypted message is "8 5 12 12 15".
